intro: Veronica rigida, commonly known as rigid speedwell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Veronica rigida thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
